With the exception of [[1904 Summer Olympics|1904]] and possible [[1916 Summer Olympics|1916]] sailing was always a part of the Olympic program. The Sailing program of 1924 consisted of a total of three sailing classes (disciplines). For each class a series of elimination and semi-final races was scheduled, from 10â26 July, at [[Meulan]] at the river [[Seine]], for the French National Monotype class, and on the [[English Channel]] off the coast of [[Le Havre]] for the Metre classes. == Venue == === Meulan === {{Infobox settlement | name = Cercle de la Voile de Paris
Bassin Olympique de Meulan
Les Mureaux | image_seal = | image_skyline = Club House de Cercle de la Voile de Paris Ã  Meulan.jpg | image_flag = | pushpin_map_caption = | latd = 49 |latm = 00 |lats = 24 |latNS = N | longd = 1 |longm = 54 |longs = 26 |longEW = E }} Meulan was the venue for the Olympic regatta's in the ''French National Monotype''. The host club for the 1924 Olympic Sailing at Meulan was the ''Cercle de la Voile de Paris''. Like in 1900 the race conditions at Meulan during the Olympic regatta were not ideal. The light breeze during the first elimination series could hardly make the sailing interesting. When the wind picked up in the second series the conditions must have improved. During the first semi-final the wind came from South East. As a result the yachts could sail most of the course without tacking or jibing, therefore not challenging the capabilities of the sailors. In the second semi-final however the wind shifted to East-North-East so that tacking was needed in the final legs of the laps. ===Le Havre === {{Infobox settlement | name = la SociÃ©tÃ© des RÃ©gates du Havre
